titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the University Relations Records 1971/1997

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: The collection arrived at the archives in relatively good order and in general the original order has been maintained. Materials in the collection include departmental records, extensive press clippings, and videos.

bioghist.head: Historical Note:
bioghist.p: The Office of University Relations, as documented in these records, formed part of the Division of University Advancement alongside the Office of Development. The Office of University Relations supported the university through the offices of internal and external communications, publications, and marketing. The Office of External Communications generated communications pieces, such as news releases to the media, and responses to media inquiries on behalf of the university. Its goal was to ensure information about the university and its colleges is communicated accurately and timely to the public via the news media, both local and beyond. The Office of Internal Communications disseminated major university news and events to faculty, staff and students. The Office of University Marketing sought to enhance the University of Houston's efforts to bolster the image of the university.

As of February 2017, the Division of University Advancement focuses on Development and Alumni Relations, whereas many of the other responsibilities formerly identified with the Office of University Relations are now associated with the Division of University Marketing, Communication and Media Relations.
[1] Division of University Advancement http://www.uh.edu/about/offices/university-advancement/ accessed February 20, 2017
[2] Division of University Marketing, Communication and Media Relations http://www.uh.edu/about/offices/ummr/ accessed February 20, 2017

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: The material in this collection is in the public domain. Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: University Relations Records, Special Collections, University of Houston. To cite a specific item from this collection, please consult the most recent edition of your style manual for the proper formatting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection arrived at the archives in relatively good order and in general the original order has been maintained. Materials in the collection include departmental records, extensive press clippings, and videos. The collection dates from 1948-1997 with most of the materials dating from 1977 to 1997. The collection is organized into four series: Faculty Vitas, Departmental Records, Press Clippings, and Audio Visual Materials. The collection did contain a sizable amount of photographic materials in all formats (slides, negatives, prints, contact sheets, etc), that have been separated to form part of the UH Photographs Collection. The Office of University Relations also contained a large number of faculty vitas that were transferred to the Faculty Vita Records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains one hundred and seventy-four folders, arranged alphabetically. It consists of City Council Awards given to faculty members, annual reports, reports to the community and various other files used within the department. Materials in this series date from 1948-1997 and are arranged alphabetically.

Public Relations Report - School of Technology

Your Hometown News Houston Post Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains twenty-seven folders dating from 1977-1980, arranged alphabetically. The folders contain materials including invitations, guest lists, receipts, memos, and other items related to the preparations necessary for these events. The original order has been maintained except where items were obviously mis-filed.

did.unittitle: College of Optometry, Building Invitation List
College of Pharmacy, Texas Medical Center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In Memoriam are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual. Each record contains information (education, birth and death dates, place of birth, and positions held) for faculty, staff, and benefactors, associated with the university.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In Appreciation and In Resolutions are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual. Each record contains information for each person or benefactors associated with the university, and outline the major accomplishments of those persons or entities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: In Resolution are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual or organization. Each record contains information for faculty, staff, and benefactors, associated with the university and outline the major accomplishments of those persons or entities

did.unittitle: The Attainment of Excellence in the Athletics Program
Dr. and Mrs. Richard J. Gonzalez

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Silver Anniversary Certificates are arranged alphabetically, according to the last name of the individual, with group recognitions for Former Faculty Members and Recognized Faculty at the end. Each record contains information for faculty and staff associated with the university and outlines the major accomplishments of the individuals.

did.unittitle: Former Faculty Members: S. W. Henderson, Floy P. Soule, A. W. French, E. M. Schuhmann, Jules A. Vern, M. A. Miller, A. L. Kerbow

Recognized Faculty: Frederic Browne, Mrs. Bessie Ebaugh, Dr. C. F. Hiller, Dr. Alva Kerbow, Dr. Louis Kestenberg, C. F. McElhinney, L. Standlee Mitchell, Miss Zelda Osborne, Warren Rees, Mrs. Lillian Warren, Dr. Joseph S. Werlin, Mrs. Ruth Wikoff

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains ninety-one folders dating from 1977-1997, arranged chronologically by month. The articles relate to a variety of university topics including, athletics, special events, awards and many others. However, the amount of informational content within the clippings varies greatly. Some articles are extensive or in-depth in nature where others may include only a brief mention of the university or a direct quote by a faculty member. The original order was chronological which has been maintained except where items were obviously miss-filed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of a variety of audio and video tapes including one-inch video, three quarter inch Umatic, VHS, one-eighth inch reel to reel audio, audio cassettes, and several others. Most of them contain public service announcements relating to various university departments or events. The photographs that were originally part of this series have been removed and placed with all other University of Houston historic photographs.
